concept.title: Referencing Field Names
concept.shortdesc: To understand references to fields, think of the record as a root directory. A reference to a field is the path to the field, or field path.

conbody.p: processorsreferencing field namesfield namesreferencingWhen a record is a line of text, the fields are one level of subdirectories. A reference to a field in a text record is simply: /<field name>
So a field named CITY displays as /CITY.
When a record is complex, like a JSON object, the root object might include many additional objects. In this case, a reference to a field is the path to the field: /<path to field>/<field name>
For example, a field in a JSON tweet might display as /users/followers_count.

After you preview data or select fields using preview data, you can generally select fields from a list. When a list is not available or when defining a new field name, use the appropriate format to reference the field.

For example, when you define an output field for an Expression Evaluator, you can select from a list of fields passed from the previous stage. But to create a new field for the results of the expression, you enter a field name, such as /Code.
